body: This is something we actually struggle quite a bit with ourselves. We do have to support various versions of our software, not all using the same go version, and basically had to "vendor" go itself, making go a versioned dependency of our projects and wrapping all uses under tools which deal with setting the various environment variables as needed. This goes a bit beyond the initial scope of the discussion, but being able to actually attach projects to a go version (and then map this to an actual go installation) is something I could see a usage for.
